document.title: Configuring an external editor
document.paragraph:
1Configuring an external editor By clicking on , or by
../../reference/05_general_interface_description/10_general_interface_mechanisms/10_pick_and_drop.xml dropping a pebble on it, you can launch an external editor. By default, this editor is VI on Unix and Notepad on Windows. You can tell EiffelStudio to launch another editor by editing the preferences. To do so, first open the
../../reference/85_preferences/10_overview.xml preferences window by choosing Preferences... in the Toolsmenu. Select then the "Global preferences" category in the preferences tree. Click on "Command used to launch an external editor" and modify the command line so that it calls your favorite editor. You can use keywords that represent the filename ($target)and the line number ($line) as is explained in the
../../reference/85_preferences/20_preferences_reference/10_global_preferences.xml preferences reference .
After modifying the command line, click on save and exitto complete the change.
